title: 105_hr2688
content: The Act may be cited as the "Economic Development Information Act of 1997". It includes findings and declarations. Congress finds that accurate and timely information on economic development programs is crucial for maintaining the national economy and assisting regions with high unemployment. Previous efforts by the Economic Development Administration have been successful in providing information to communities affected by military base closures or defense industry downsizing. Congress declares the importance of maintaining a strong national economy. Congress emphasizes the need to expand economic development information to assist areas facing economic distress or deterioration. This information should provide access to various government and economic resources in a user-friendly format. The Public Works and Economic Development Act of 1965 is amended to include a new section on the Office of Economic Development Information. This aims to provide user-friendly access to government and economic resources for areas in economic distress. The Secretary will establish an Office of Economic Development Information within the Economic Development Administration. The Office will serve as a central information hub for economic development programs at the federal, state, and local levels, assisting applicants in accessing financial and technical assistance. It will also develop electronic links to information databases to facilitate the identification and application for resources under economic development programs. The Office of Economic Development Information will assist in accessing and applying for economic development programs at federal, state, and local levels. It will develop electronic links to databases with relevant information on program details, eligibility criteria, and economic data. The Office of Economic Development Information provides resources on trade agreements, defense spending, technological change, economic development case studies, technology utilization programs, revolving loan fund programs, and sustainable development initiatives. It also ensures public access to data services. The Office of Economic Development Information ensures public access to data services through various means such as an Internet website, a toll-free telephone number, online electronic access, printed manuals, and periodic orientation workshops. The Office of Economic Development Information provides public access to data services through various means such as an Internet website, a toll-free telephone number, printed manuals, periodic orientation workshops, and on-call information specialists. The Secretary is required to coordinate with other Federal departments and agencies to achieve the objectives of this section, and economic development includes economic adjustment, disaster recovery, industrial retention, and defense reinvestment. Authorization of appropriations is provided for the implementation of this section.
